article:
'Action role-playing games' (abbreviated 'action RPG', 'action/RPG', or 'ARPG')
form a loosely defined sub-genre of role-playing video games that incorporate
elements of action or action-adventure games, emphasizing real-time action where
the player has direct control over characters, instead of turn-based or menu-
based combat. These games often use combat systems similar to hack and slash or
shooter games.
